user_prompt: Premise: The bridge is open, so cars can cross the river. Change: The bridge is closed. Question: Can cars cross the river now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The store is open, so customers may enter. Change: The store is locked. Question: May customers enter now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The phone has battery, so it can turn on. Change: The battery is removed. Question: Can it turn on now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The gate is unlocked, so visitors can enter. Change: The gate is locked. Question: Can visitors enter now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The lamp is plugged in, so it can light. Change: It is unplugged. Question: Can it light now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The path is clear, so bikes can pass. Change: The path is blocked. Question: Can bikes pass now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The light is green, so cars can go. Change: The light turns red. Question: Can cars go now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The door is open, so people can exit. Change: The door is jammed shut. Question: Can people exit now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The faucet is on, so water flows. Change: The water main is shut off. Question: Does water flow now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The printer has paper, so it can print. Change: It runs out of paper. Question: Can it print now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The stove is lit, so the pot will boil. Change: The stove is turned off. Question: Will the pot boil now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The router is online, so Wi‑Fi works. Change: The router loses power. Question: Does Wi‑Fi work now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The car has fuel, so it can drive. Change: The tank is empty. Question: Can it drive now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The lock is open, so the door can swing. Change: The lock is engaged. Question: Can the door swing now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The app has internet, so it can sync. Change: Internet is disconnected. Question: Can it sync now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The valve is open, so water reaches the field. Change: The valve is closed. Question: Does water reach the field now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The heater is on, so the room warms. Change: The heater is unplugged. Question: Does the room warm now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The elevator has power, so it operates. Change: Power is cut. Question: Does it operate now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The seed was planted, so it can sprout. Change: The seed is removed from soil. Question: Can it sprout now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The battery is charged, so the lamp can turn on. Change: Battery drained. Question: Can the lamp turn on now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The door is unlocked, so guests can enter. Change: The door is barricaded. Question: Can guests enter now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The path is lit, so hikers can see. Change: The lights go out. Question: Can hikers see now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The faucet is on, so the basin fills. Change: The drain is open. Question: Does the basin fill now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The blinds are open, so light enters. Change: The blinds are closed. Question: Does light enter now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The sprayer is on, so plants get water. Change: The sprayer is off. Question: Do plants get water now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The charger is connected, so the phone gains charge. Change: The charger is unplugged. Question: Does the phone gain charge now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The track is open, so trains can pass. Change: The track is blocked. Question: Can trains pass now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The rope is intact, so the bridge holds. Change: The rope snaps. Question: Does the bridge hold now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The sprinkler is on, so grass gets wet. Change: Water supply is cut. Question: Does grass get wet now? Answer yes or no.
Premise: The window is open, so fresh air enters. Change: The window is closed. Question: Does fresh air enter now? Answer yes or no.
